com.twitter.heron.streamlet

Interface KVStreamlet<K,V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Streamlet<KeyValue<K,V>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseKVStreamlet, JoinStreamlet, KVFlatMapStreamlet, KVMapStreamlet, ReduceByKeyAndWindowStreamlet, ReduceByWindowStreamlet, SourceKVStreamlet, SupplierKVStreamlet

    @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public interface KVStreamlet<K,V>
extends Streamlet<KeyValue<K,V>>
    Some transformations like join and reduce assume a certain structure of the tuples that it is processing. These transformations act on tuples of type KeyValue that have an identifiable Key and Value components. Thus a KVStreamlet is just a special kind of Streamlet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> join(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other, WindowConfig windowCfg, SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
      Return a new KVStreamlet by inner joining 'this streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet.
      <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> leftJoin(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other, WindowConfig windowCfg, SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
      Return a new KVStreamlet by left joining ‘this’ streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet.
      <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> outerJoin(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other, WindowConfig windowCfg, SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
      Return a new KVStreamlet by outer joining ‘this’ streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet.
      KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,V> reduceByKeyAndWindow(WindowConfig windowCfg, SerializableBinaryOperator<V> reduceFn)
      Return a new Streamlet in which for each time_window, all elements are belonging to the same key are reduced using the BinaryOperator and the result is emitted.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.twitter.heron.streamlet.Streamlet

        clone, consume, filter, flatMap, flatMapToKV, getName, getNumPartitions, log, map, mapToKV, reduceByWindow, repartition, repartition, setName, setNumPartitions, toSink, transform, union

    • Method Detail

      • join

        <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> join(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other,
                                            WindowConfig windowCfg,
                                            SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
        Return a new KVStreamlet by inner joining 'this streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet. The join is done over elements accumulated over a time window defined by TimeWindow.
        Parameters:
        other - The Streamlet that we are joining with.
        windowCfg - This is a specification of what kind of windowing strategy you like to have. Typical windowing strategies are sliding windows and tumbling windows
        joinFunction - The join function that needs to be applied

      • leftJoin

        <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> leftJoin(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other,
                                                WindowConfig windowCfg,
                                                SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
        Return a new KVStreamlet by left joining ‘this’ streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet. The join is done over elements accumulated over a time window defined by TimeWindow. Because its a left join, it is guaranteed that all elements of this streamlet will show up in the resulting joined streamlet.
        Parameters:
        other - The Streamlet that we are joining with.
        windowCfg - This is a specification of what kind of windowing strategy you like to have. Typical windowing strategies are sliding windows and tumbling windows
        joinFunction - The join function that needs to be applied

      • outerJoin

        <V2,VR> KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,VR> outerJoin(KVStreamlet<K,V2> other,
                                                 WindowConfig windowCfg,
                                                 SerializableBiFunction<? super V,? super V2,? extends VR> joinFunction)
        Return a new KVStreamlet by outer joining ‘this’ streamlet with ‘other’ streamlet. The join is done over elements accumulated over a time window defined by TimeWindow. Because its a outer join, it is guaranteed that all elements of both this streamlet and 'other' streamlet will show up in the resulting joined streamlet.
        Parameters:
        other - The Streamlet that we are joining with.
        windowCfg - This is a specification of what kind of windowing strategy you like to have. Typical windowing strategies are sliding windows and tumbling windows
        joinFunction - The join function that needs to be applied

      • reduceByKeyAndWindow

        KVStreamlet<KeyedWindow<K>,V> reduceByKeyAndWindow(WindowConfig windowCfg,
                                                   SerializableBinaryOperator<V> reduceFn)
        Return a new Streamlet in which for each time_window, all elements are belonging to the same key are reduced using the BinaryOperator and the result is emitted.
        Parameters:
        windowCfg - This is a specification of what kind of windowing strategy you like to have. Typical windowing strategies are sliding windows and tumbling windows
        reduceFn - The reduce function that you want to apply to all the values of a key.
